doc:
Skip Young (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skip_Young_(actor) 0 Skip Young (born Ronald Plumstead; March 14, 1930 – March 17, 1993) was an American actor best known for his decade-long role as Wally Plumstead in the ABC sitcom The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet. When chosen to join Ozzie Nelson's television series, Young suggested that the last name of his character be "Plumstead". In 1957, Young had a part as Elvis Presley's friend Teddy in the movie "Loving You". In 1958, he portrayed Sam the Bass Player in the picture Earth v. the Spider. In 1959, he was cast as Martin in the episode "Premonition" of the anthology series Alcoa Presents: One Step Beyond. In 1960, he played George Allison in the episode "Bud Lives It Up" of NBC's Father Knows Best with Robert Young as Jim Anderson and Billy Gray as his son, Bud Anderson. In 1961, he played George Collingwood in the episode "Mike in a Rush" of ABC's My Three Sons, with Fred MacMurray as Steve Douglas and Tim Considine as oldest son, Mike Douglas. Skip Young ( born Ronald_Plumstead ; March_14_,_1930 – March_17_,_1993 ) was an_American_actor best_known for his_decade-long_role as Wally_Plumstead in the_ABC_sitcom The_Adventures of Ozzie_and_Harriet . When chosen_to_join Ozzie_Nelson 's_television_series , Young suggested that the_last_name of his_character be " Plumstead " . In 1957 , Young had a_part as Elvis_Presley 's_friend_Teddy in the_movie " Loving You " . In 1958 , he portrayed Sam the_Bass_Player in the_picture Earth v. the_Spider . In 1959 , he was_cast as Martin in the_episode_"_Premonition " of the_anthology_series_Alcoa Presents : One_Step_Beyond . In 1960 , he played George_Allison in the_episode " Bud Lives It Up " of NBC 's_Father_Knows_Best with Robert_Young as Jim_Anderson and Billy_Gray as his_son , Bud_Anderson . In 1961 , he played George_Collingwood in the_episode " Mike in a_Rush " of ABC 's_My_Three_Sons , with Fred_MacMurray as Steve_Douglas and Tim_Considine_as_oldest_son , Mike_Douglas .
